abstract: Federal Judge Valerie E Caproni says prosecutors may introduce evidence into corruption trial of former New York State assembly speaker Sheldon Silver showing he sought to block methadone clinic from relocating near Lower Manhattan building owned by developer Glenwood Management; Silver is charged with receiving kickbacks for helping developer.
lead_paragraph: A judge ruled that prosecutors may introduce evidence showing that the former State Assembly speaker took action on behalf of a real estate developer to block a methadone clinic’s relocation.

headline.main: Sheldon Silver Trial Can Include Clinic Move, Federal Judge Says
headline.print_headline: Silver Trial Can Include Clinic Move, Judge Says

snippet: A judge ruled that prosecutors may introduce evidence showing that the former State Assembly speaker took action on behalf of a real estate developer to block a methadone clinic’s relocation.
